questions.text: A 22-Year-old female with a height of 5'3 inch, and a BMI – of 23.5 kg/m2 came to the labour room so that she can be assessed for induction of labour. Her period of gestation is 40 weeks. Her bishop score calculated by the senior resident is 8. Which of the following given information is in favour of the successful induction of labour?

options.label: A
options.text: 40 weeks of gestation

options.label: B
options.text: Bishop score 8

options.label: C
options.text: 22 years of age

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Option A. 40 weeks of gestation - near-term or post-term. Option B. Bishop score 8 - (>=6 is favourable for induction of labour) Option C. 22 years of age - younger age.

Highyeild:

Favourable factors predicting successful induction of labour are: The positive oxytocin sensitivity test is favourable. Favourable in multiparous and in cases with PROM. Less responsive in elderly primigravidae or cases with prolonged retention of dead fetuses. Maternal height > 5'; normal BMI, efw < 3 KG. Presence of fetal fibronectin (ffn) in vaginal swabs (> 50 ng/ml).

questions.text: A 22-Year-old primigravida at 41 weeks of pog is about to undergo induction via the arm. Which of the following is not a common indication for surgical methods of induction?

options.label: A
options.text: Intrauterine fetal death

options.label: B
options.text: Abruptio placentae

options.label: C
options.text: Chronic hydramnios

options.label: D
options.text: To place a scalp electrode for fetal monitoring

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Intrauterine fetal death

Highyeild:

Indications for induction of labour: Premature rupture of membranes. In combination with surgical induction. Surgical methods are used when there are: Abruptio placentae ( Option B) Chronic hydramnios ( Option C) Severe pre-eclampsia/eclampsia In combination with medical induction. To place scalp electrodes for electronic fetal monitoring ( Option D)

questions.text: A primigravida came to the labour room at 42 weeks of pog for induction of labour. On pv examination, the cervix is 2cm dilated, and 40 % effaced. The vertex is at +1 station and the cervix is soft and midline. What is the bishop score of the lady?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

8 To calculate the bishop score we should know the criteria and the scoring system: Bishop scoring system: Score Dilation (cm) Position of cervix Effacement % Station (-3 to +3) Cervical Consistency 0 closed Posterior 0-30 -3 Firm 1 1-2 Mid position 40-50 -2 Medium 2 3-4 Anterior 60-70 -1,0 Soft 3 5-6 – 80 +1, +2 – Hence according to this, for each criteria score for our patient will be: Cervix is 2cm dilated - 1 40% effaced-1 The vertex is at +1 station- 3 Cervix is soft - 2 Position midline- 1 Hence total score is 8

questions.text: A woman at 41 weeks of pog undergoes induction of labour with amniotomy followed by oxytocin infusion. Contractions observed after 6 hours are 3/ 10 min of 30 sec. FHR is normal. Which of the following can be the contraindications for induction of labour? Previous classical caesarean section Postmaturity Patient known case of organic heart disease Antepartum haemorrhage Cervical carcinoma Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 3, 4, 5

Highyeild:

The known contraindications for induction of labour are: Contracted pelvis and cephalopelvic disproportion malpresentation (breech, transverse or oblique lie). Previous classical cesarean section or hysterectomy, uteroplacental factors. Unexplained vaginal bleeding, Vasa Previa, placenta previa Active genital herpes infection High-risk pregnancy with fetal compromise Heart disease pelvic tumour or cervical carcinoma Elderly primigravida with obstetric or medical complications Umbilical cord prolapse Note: Postmaturity is an indication for induction of labour.

questions.text: After the successful delivery of the baby, the obstetrician witnesses that the episiotomy performed has extended away backwards beyond the perineal body. Which among the following structures is likely to be injured in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: External anal sphincter

options.label: B
options.text: Ischiocavernosus

options.label: C
options.text: Bulbospongiosus

options.label: D
options.text: Urethral sphincter

questions.explanation:
Solution:

External anal sphincter The perineal body is a midline structure that attaches to different muscles and ligaments. The muscle that lies posterior to the perineal body is the anal sphincter. The perineal body is not a structure but an aggregation of fibromuscular tissue located in the midline at the junction between the anal and urogenital triangles, just ventral to the anal sphincter. Ten muscles of the perineum converge and interlace in the perineal body.

Highyeild:

Two unpaired; Four Paired Muscles Fibres of longitudinal muscle coat of anal canal Fibres from the external anal sphincter, four unpaired muscles Bulbospongiosus Superficial transverse pereni Deep transverse pereni Levator ani Note: In females, sphincter urethrovaginalis is also attached here.

questions.text: All of the following are true about augmentation of labour except:

options.label: A
options.text: Twin pregnancy precludes the use of oxytocin

options.label: B
options.text: Amniotomy decreases the need for oxytocin use

options.label: C
options.text: Methods of augmentation do increase the risk of surgical intervention

options.label: D
options.text: Associated with a risk of uterine hyperstimulation

questions.correct_answer: A. Twin pregnancy precludes the use of oxytocin
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Twin pregnancy precludes the use of oxytocin Twin pregnancy precludes the use of oxytocin. Provided women with twins meet all criteria for oxytocin administration, it may be used.

Highyeild:

Augmentation of labour is the process of stimulating the uterus to increase the frequency, duration and intensity of contractions after the onset of spontaneous labour. It has commonly been used to treat delayed labour when poor uterine contractions are assessed to be the underlying cause. Prolonged labour: Also known as “failure to progress,” this can cause low oxygen levels and abnormal heart rhythms in your little one. If the baby isn’t born after 18-24 hours of regular contractions, augmentation of labour may be recommended. Preeclampsia: The stress of delivery paired with preeclampsia or other hypertension disorders can affect the baby, and a quicker delivery can be advantageous. Premature rupture of the membranes (PROM): In most pregnancies, water will break after contractions begin. However if the amniotic sac ruptures before, or early on in contractions, the woman is on the clock to deliver the baby within 24-48 hours to prevent infection.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option B : Amniotomy decreases the need for oxytocin use. Amniotomy with oxytocin augmentation for arrested active-phase labour shortened the time to delivery by 44 minutes compared with that of oxytocin alone. Option C : Methods of augmentation do increase the risk of operational management. Option D : Associated with a risk of uterine hyperstimulation is true.

questions.text: The best method of induction of labour in hydramnios:

options.label: A
options.text: High rupture of the membranes

options.label: B
options.text: Low rupture of the membranes

options.label: C
options.text: Abdominal amniocentesis followed by stabilizing oxytocin drip

options.label: D
options.text: Prostaglandins

questions.correct_answer: C. Abdominal amniocentesis followed by stabilizing oxytocin drip
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Abdominal amniocentesis followed by stabilizing oxytocin drip Abdominal amniocentesis followed by stabilizing oxytocin drip is the best method of induction of labour in hydramnios.

Highyeild:

Method of induction: Amniocentesis→drainage of a good amount of liquor→to check the favourable lie and presentation of the fetus→a stabilizing oxytocin infusion is started→low rupture of the membranes is done when the lie becomes stable and the presenting part gets fixed to the pelvis. This will minimize sudden decompression with separation of the placenta, change in the lie of the fetus and cord prolapse.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A, B. Artificial rupture of membranes is C/I in polyhydramnios as it leads to sudden decompression of the uterus which can cause abruptio placenta.

questions.text: During the delivery of a primigravida at 40 weeks of gestation, the mother was having a uterine contraction of 2 for 10 minutes for 25 seconds duration. She was receiving oxytocin infusion at a rate of 8 drops per minute. You notice the junior resident performing the following procedure. Which of the following statements is true about this?

options.label: A
options.text: It can be done in chronic hydramnios but avoided in acute hydramnios

options.label: B
options.text: It is done with the help of Babcock forceps

options.label: C
options.text: FHR status is monitored before and after the procedure

options.label: D
options.text: Prophylactic antibiotics are always prescribed

questions.correct_answer: C. FHR status is monitored before and after the procedure
questions.explanation:
Solution:

FHR status is monitored before and after the procedure The given procedure shown is arm i.e. artificial rupture of membranes. The membranes below the presenting part overlying the internal os are ruptured to drain some amount of amniotic fluid. Options A, B and D are false.

Highyeild:

Artificial rupture of membranes (AROM), also known as an amniotomy, was once thought to be an effective means to induce or accelerate labour. The membranes can be ruptured using a specialized tool, such as an amnihook or amnicot , or they may be ruptured by the proceduralist's finger. We monitor the fetal heart rate to know if there is sudden decompression or not.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A. It can be done in chronic hydramnios but avoided in acute hydramnios is a wrong statement as it is avoided in chronic hydramnios due to the risk of sudden massive liquor drainage and sudden uterine decompression that may precipitate placental separation. Option B. It is done with the help of Kocher's forceps and not Babcock's forceps , so this statement is wrong. The given image shows Kocher forceps: Prophylactic antibiotic may be given and not always prescribed. A sterile vulval pad is used and asepsis is maintained.\ Option D. Prophylactic antibiotics are not always prescribed. Theyre only given in a high risk patient.

questions.text: Incorrect statement regarding the following instrument:

options.label: A
options.text: It's Kochers forceps used for ARM

options.label: B
options.text: In ARM membranes are torn by twisting movements

options.label: C
options.text: If the head is not engaged, ARM can be done by pushing the head to the brim of pelvis to prevent cord prolapse

options.label: D
options.text: It can be used for ARM in a 23-year-old, 40 weeks gestational age, os closed with no known complications

questions.correct_answer: D. It can be used for ARM in a 23-year-old, 40 weeks gestational age, os closed with no known complications
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It can be used for ARM in a 23-year-old, 40 weeks gestational age, os closed with no known complications This is Kocher's forceps used for ARM.ARM can't be done in a long, firm, cervix with os closed. All other statements are true.

Highyeild:

Artificial rupture of membranes (AROM), also known as an amniotomy, was once thought to be an effective means to induce or accelerate labour. The membranes can be ruptured using a specialized tool, such as an amnihook or amnicot , or they may be ruptured by the proceduralist's finger.

questions.text: The following instrument is used for?

options.label: A
options.text: Induction in 23-year-old, 40-week gestational age GDM patient with EFW of 4.5kg

options.label: B
options.text: Induction in 34-year-old 34 weeks gestational age patient with eclampsia with active herpes

options.label: C
options.text: Induction of 26-year-old, 32 weeks with fetal demise

options.label: D
options.text: Induction of a patient with abruptio placenta

questions.correct_answer: D. Induction of a patient with abruptio placenta
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Induction of a patient with abruptio placenta The image is of Amnio Hook and it is used for ARM.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A. Induction in 23-year-old, 40-week gestational age. GDM patient with EFW of 4.5kg - Macrosomia is a contraindication for IOL. Option B. Induction in 34-year-old 34-week gestational age patients with eclampsia with active herpes - Active herpes is a contraindication for IOL and ARM. Option C. Induction of 26-year-old, 32 weeks with fetal demise. Contraindication for ARM.

Extraedge:

Amnio Hook is designed to perforate the amniotic membrane with a rigid talon tip. Amnio Hook is slightly curved and 25cm in length.

questions.text: Which of the following patients will you not induce labour for?

options.label: A
options.text: 23-year-old 39 weeks with BP of 150/100 mmHg

options.label: B
options.text: 26-year-old 40 weeks with GDM controlled on diet

options.label: C
options.text: 23 years old 42 weeks with active genital herpes

options.label: D
options.text: 32-year-old multigravida 39 weeks with a history of genital herpes and AFI less than 3

questions.correct_answer: C. 23 years old 42 weeks with active genital herpes
questions.explanation:
Solution:

23 years old 42 weeks with active genital herpes 23 years old 42 weeks with active genital herpes will not be a suitable candidate for inducing labour. Options A, B & D : induction can be done.

questions.text: You are posted in the labour room as an intern and you observe the following device being used by junior residents before oxytocin infusion is initiated in a primigravida at 40 weeks of gestation. Which of the following is not true about this device?

options.label: A
options.text: It contains 10mg of PGE2 analogue.

options.label: B
options.text: It is kept in the vagina and released at 0.3mg/hr during a 10-hour period.

options.label: C
options.text: The insert is removed after 12 hours or with labour onset and at least 30 minutes before administration of oxytocin.

options.label: D
options.text: Following insertion, it is not needed for women to remain recumbent for 2 hours, as studies have shown no benefit.

questions.correct_answer: D. Following insertion, it is not needed for women to remain recumbent for 2 hours, as studies have shown no benefit.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Following insertion, it is not needed for women to remain recumbent for 2 hours, as studies have shown no benefit. Options A, B & C are true statements.

Highyeild:

The given image is of cervidil vaginal insert which contains 10 mg of dinoprostone which is PGE2. It is kept in the vagina and released at 3mg/hr during a 10-hour period. The insert is removed after 12 hours or with labour onset and at least 30 minutes before administration of oxytocin. Side effects such as fever, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, or abdominal pain are uncommon and usually mild.

Extraedge:

This drug should not be used if the woman is carrying more than one baby if labour has already started, or if water has broken.
